title: Requires school districts to make their budgets and an itemized summary of expenditures and revenue available in printed form and on the internet
summary: Requires school districts, outside of any city having a population of 1,000,000 or more, to make their budgets and an itemized summary of expenditures and revenue available in printed form and on the internet if such a website is operated by the school district.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3874

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 28, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, to require school districts  to  make
         an  itemized summary of their budgets, expenditures and revenue avail-
         able to the public

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new section 1501-d
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  1501-D. AVAILABILITY OF BUDGET, EXPENDITURE AND REVENUE INFORMATION
    4  TO THE PUBLIC. EVERY SCHOOL DISTRICT, EXCEPT A CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT IN A
    5  CITY HAVING A POPULATION OF ONE MILLION OR MORE, SHALL COMPILE, PUBLISH,
    6  UPDATE IN A TIMELY MANNER AND MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC,  THE  SCHOOL
    7  DISTRICT  BUDGET,  AND  AN  ITEMIZED  SUMMARY OF ALL EXPENDITURES OF AND
    8  REVENUE RECEIVED BY SUCH DISTRICT. SUCH INFORMATION SHALL BE MADE AVAIL-
    9  ABLE IN PRINTED FORM AND ON THE SCHOOL  DISTRICT  INTERNET  WEBSITE,  IF
   10  SUCH  A WEBSITE IS OPERATED BY THE SCHOOL DISTRICT.  THE COMMISSIONER IS
   11  AUTHORIZED TO PROMULGATE SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS AS SHALL  BE  NECES-
   12  SARY TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   13    S  2.  This  act  shall  take  effect  on  the first of September next
   14  succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law,  provided  that
   15  effective  immediately  any rules and regulations necessary to implement
   16  the provisions of this act on its  effective  date  are  authorized  and
   17  directed to be completed on or before such date.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
